data.title: The `DetonateAttack` target type should not be hard-coded in `DemoTruck` and `MadTank`
data.body:
Currently, the `DenotateAttack` target type is hard-coded into the `Orders` of both `DemoTruck` and `MadTank`. They should rather be exposed as yaml fields on the respective `Info` classes to allow for the possibility of multiple target types.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27882309-the-detonateattack-target-type-should-not-be-hard-coded-in-demotruck-and-madtank?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: C4 target type doesn't do anything/C4Demolition ignores target type.
data.body:
The `C4` damage type is defined in a lot of places, but it doesn't actually do anything. This is because C4 is not a weapon but a `C4Demolition` trait, and this trait does its targeting checks via `Demolishable`.

Either the `C4` target type should be removed, because it's misleading, or logic should be added to `C4Demolition` or `Demolishable` to check the target type for validity.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27882266-c4-target-type-doesn-t-do-anything-c4demolition-ignores-target-type?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Stolen resources count towards earned/spent
data.body:
When a player steals resources from another by capturing a building, this goes via `GiveResources` and `TakeResources`. As a result, the players' `Earned` and `Spent` values are updated according to the steal, even though they probably should not be.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27882194-stolen-resources-count-towards-earned-spent?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: No overflow checking in `Stored` property for resources
data.body:
In `StoresResources.cs:34`:

```
        [Sync] public int Stored { get { return player.ResourceCapacity == 0 ? 0 : info.Capacity * player.Resources / player.ResourceCapacity; } }
```

This line will cause integer overflow if `info.Capacity * player.Resources` is sufficiently large, resulting in potentially a negative value for `Stored`. This can manifest as losing money when stealing a refinery in some mods that have the capacities set unreasonably high, for instance.

data.title: Show only missing required "mod (version)"s
data.body: As requested in @Phrohdoh's [comment](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9463#issuecomment-152861123) to #9463 for the mod installer.

data.title: Work around a hang on shutdown caused by IRC
data.body:
Our IRC client doesn't shut down properly - but we only need to shut it down when we're about to close the game anyway, so we just don't bother since it won't hurt anybody.

Fixes #9869.

data.title: prevent allied units from autoattack building which is being captured…
data.body: …. resolves #6170.

data.title: Unglobal file system
data.body: The next step toward thirdparty mod support (last step before my PR for #8992).

data.title: Detach some event handlers
data.body:
Some classes attach event handlers to classes that live longer than they do, thus they end up extending their lifetime beyond what we normally expect because the event handler reference keeps them alive.

This leads to a few "memory leak" style scenarios where we don't reclaim memory because it still has references. Explicitly removing the event handlers when these classes are done with prevents this problem.

Fixes #9841.

data.title: Attack-move works unreliably in new playtest
data.body: I was playing the playtest online and was quite frustrated that the attack-move function seemed to only work about 60% of the time. Another player in the game I played complained of the same thing.

This is especially noticeable at the start of soviet 04a where a 108 debris is at the center of the base.

data.title: Fix (HealthPercentage)DamageWarheads ignoring stances.
data.body:
How come noone noticed this before, I wonder... target validity was never checked at these two compared to `SpreadDamageWarhead`.

Fixes  #9107.

data.title: TerrainSpriteLayer memory sink
data.body:
Whilst profiling https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9627, I came across this hard-to-miss memory sink. It happens each time you start another map. Here's the difference from baseline to after jumping between skirmish and title screen for a while:

OpenRA.Graphics.TerrainSpriteLayer
+114 instances
+209,198,208 bytes

Almost all of that memory is composed of OpenRA.Graphics.Vertex[] inside the TerrainSpriteLayer.

data.body: ![graphical issues](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/10866348/d1e6f5a6-802a-11e5-9dae-cf7cf9d105c3.png)

data.title: Performance on latest playtest seems significantly worse than release 20150614
data.body:
I downloaded and installed the Windows packages of release 20150614 and playtest 20151031 and ran one instance each. On my system (Win7x64, i5-2500 @ 3.5 GHz, Turbo disabled), `Tick` on the RA shellmap on older release hovered in the 2.5-3.3 ms range, while the playtest varied from 3.2-5.2ms.

`Render` was ~1.7-2.2ms for both.

Their respective `perf.log` (I used local `support` dir) didn't turn up anything out of the ordinary, in fact going by `perf.log` alone, the playtest should have been a bit faster.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27862489-performance-on-latest-playtest-seems-significantly-worse-than-release-20150614?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Per-warhead WarheadDebugOverlay colors
data.body:
This allows any warhead to provide its own color, such as healing warheads being green.
The test commit changes the E1 in TS to use a cyan-ish color.

Inspired by @deniz1a's comment [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9465#issuecomment-148508283).

![Outdated gif](http://i.imgur.com/OlwlFVA.gif)
![newer](http://i.imgur.com/x6OyVao.gif)

data.title: AI defenses don't stop tracking units even if InitialStanceAI is set to Defend
data.body:
They do switch once a new target comes into range, but as long as that doesn't happen, AI turrets continue to track a target even if it's out of range.

data.title: Joystick scrolling doesn't work in the map editor
New hotkeys for spectators/replay observers don't work in Playtest3110
data.body:
#9307 is listed in the playtest3110 changelog. I've spectated a match, a skirmish and a replay and switched to a single player's view (within a team) but none of the new hotkeys worked for me.

Antares79 on IRC reported it working with the bleed.

data.title: Lowest pixel row in global chat window is hidden
data.body:
So underscores on the lowest lines aren't visible, for example.

Similar issue to #7447, which was fixed by #7527.

data.title: Lobby chat tabs should show unread message count
data.body: Right now there is no way to tell when new messages come in.

data.title: Global chat: Consider renaming "Leave Chat" button
data.body: Some feedback from the ingame chat: someone was worried that the "Leave Chat" button might kick them from the local server chat as well as the global chat.

data.title: Current playtest -20151031 Crushing spawns visceroids.
data.body:
This was present in the bleed but I thought it was because I was crushing on the tiberium. (Even though that doesnt happen in the original.)

I just played the playtest with some others and its been spawning them randomly by crushing. Im not sure if its only with minigunners or all infantry type. Tested with just light tanks so far.
